review_title: Too many  Directors & Managers that do not know what they are doing!!
pros: Hard working staff who try hard. Hands on staff are great, SMC gives out presents, great PR staff who know how to promote a place. Patient to staff ratios are good, the work is not hard. Promotes education, Aidet is in place and is working, patient care is good. The doctors are great, very kind & concerned about patients.
cons: Directors & Managers who do not listen to ideas from  staff. Promotes friends & employees they are unable to do their job as a staff nurse, why else does it take 2 managers per department. Managers & directors are going to classes to manage staff & are at meetings with other departments to discuss better ways to work together. Problem is when do they have time to really use what they have learned. Staff is on their own.

pros: Very education based environment.  They encourage and provide continuing education.  Offer bonuses when our patient satisfaction was good!  Great small town hospital!
cons: It is a hospital, but ultimately a business.  A few years ago the CEO wages came out. It was disheartening because they were decreasing raises, increasing insurance rates.  He was definitely not taking any cuts in pay.

pros: Great team environment, staff is shown appreciation for quality care, opportunities for growth and development, HR engaged and helpful, quality physicians who take part in decision making.
cons: I can't honestly think of a con.

review_title: Great place to work! Just not great pay. Benefits are good.
